definitions.definition: To make a pop , or sharp, quick sound.
examples: The muskets popped away on all sides.

definitions.definition: To burst (something) with a popping sound.
examples: The boy with the pin popped the balloon.

definitions.definition: To enter, or issue forth, with a quick, sudden movement; to move from place to place suddenly; to dart.
examples: A rabbit popped out of the hole.
definitions.label_groups: intransitive , with in , out , upon , etc.

definitions.definition: To place (something) (somewhere); to move or position (something) with a short movement.
examples: Just pop it in the fridge for now.
He popped his head around the door.

definitions.definition: To make a short trip or visit.
examples: I'm just popping round to the newsagent.
I'll pop by your place later today.
You wait in the car, I'm just gonna pop in the store.
definitions.label_groups: intransitive , often with over , round , along , in , etc.

definitions.definition: To stand out ; to be distinctive to the senses .

examples: He popped me on the nose.

definitions.definition: To shoot (usually somebody) with a firearm .
To remove (a data item) from the top of a stack .

examples: I had to pop my watch to see me through until pay-day.

definitions.definition: To swallow or consume (especially a tablet of a drug, sometimes extended to other small items such as sweets or candy).
To perform (a move or stunt) while riding a board or vehicle.
examples: Pop a U-turn. You missed the turnoff.

definitions.definition: To undergo equalization of pressure when the Eustachian tubes open.
examples: My ears popped as the aeroplane began to ascend.

definitions.definition: To perform the popping style of dance .

examples: He's on probation. We can pop him right now for gang association.

definitions.definition: To pull a string away from the fretboard and release it so that it snaps back.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To make a pop , or sharp, quick sound.
secondary_definitions: ( ergative ) To burst (something) with a popping sound.
( intransitive , with in , out , upon , etc. ) To enter, or issue forth, with a quick, sudden movement; to move from place to place suddenly; to dart.
( transitive , UK , Australia ) To place (something) (somewhere); to move or position (something) with a short movement.
( intransitive , often with over , round , along , in , etc. ) To make a short trip or visit.
( intransitive ) To stand out ; to be distinctive to the senses .
( transitive , slang ) To shoot (usually somebody) with a firearm .
( intransitive , vulgar , slang ) To ejaculate ; to orgasm .
( transitive , computing ) To remove (a data item) from the top of a stack .
( transitive , slang ) To pawn (something) (to raise money).
( transitive , slang ) To swallow or consume (especially a tablet of a drug, sometimes extended to other small items such as sweets or candy).
( transitive , informal ) To perform (a move or stunt) while riding a board or vehicle.
( intransitive , of the ears ) To undergo equalization of pressure when the Eustachian tubes open.
( dance ) To perform the popping style of dance .
( music ) To pull a string away from the fretboard and release it so that it snaps back.
( African-American Vernacular , slang ) To occur or happen.
